BitmapsDeclare.PointerInit: //[POINTERNAME]=(void *)&[BITMAP]; // Uncomment this line to initialize the bitmap pointer here, otherwise do it in your code before calling this CreateXXX()

FLASH_VGDD.CodeHead: extern const char L[FONT][] __attribute__((aligned(2))); const FONT_FLASH [FONT] = {0, L[FONT]};

Event.Name: SCREEN_UPDATE
Event.Description: Executes when screenState is set to UPDATE by code

Event.Name: SCREEN_DISPLAY
Event.Description: Executes continuously while screen is displayed. Use this to do timed actions in code.

Action.Name: Timed Action
Action.Code: static DWORD Tick_[SCREEN_NAME];[NEWLINE]if (tick - Tick_[SCREEN_NAME] > 100) {[NEWLINE] Tick_[SCREEN_NAME] = tick;[NEWLINE] // Do something[NEWLINE]}

Event.Name: BTN_MSG_CANCELPRESS
Event.Description: Button released with button press canceled

Action.Name: Set Button Text
Action.Code: BtnSetText((BUTTON *)GOLFindObject(ID_[CONTROLID_NOINDEX][CONTROLID_INDEX]), (XCHAR *) $Quoted string constant or variable:|"New text"$);[NEWLINE]
Action.Help: Sets the string used for the object.

Action.Name: Get Button Text
Action.Help: Returns pointer to the text string being used

Action.Name: Set Button Bitmap
Action.Help: Sets the bitmap used in the object

Action.Name: Get Button Bitmap
Action.Help: Returns the pointer to the current bitmap used.

Action.Name: Set Button Text(2)
Action.Help: Sets the string that will be used for the object

Action.Name: Get Button Text(2)
Action.Help: Returns the pointer to the text string used

Action.Name: Set Button Bitmap(2)
Action.Help: Sets the bitmap used in the object

Action.Name: Get Button Bitmap(2)
Action.Help: Returns the pointer to the current bitmap used.

Action.Name: Set StaticText Text
Action.Code: StSetText((STATICTEXT *)GOLFindObject(ID_[CONTROLID_NOINDEX][CONTROLID_INDEX]), (XCHAR *) $Quoted string constant or variable:|"New text"$);[NEWLINE]
Action.Help: Sets the string that will be used for the object

Action.Name: Get StaticText Text
Action.Help: Returns the pointer to the text string used

Action.Name: Set StaticText Text(2)
Action.Help: Sets the string that will be used for the object

Action.Name: Get StaticText Text(2)
Action.Help: Returns the pointer to the text string used

Action.Name: Set CheckBox Text
Action.Code: CbSetText((CHECKBOX *)GOLFindObject(ID_[CONTROLID_NOINDEX][CONTROLID_INDEX]), (XCHAR *) $Quoted string constant or variable:|"New text"$);[NEWLINE]
Action.Help: This function sets the text that will be used

Action.Name: Get CheckBox Text
Action.Help: Returns the location of the text used for the check box

Action.Name: Set CheckBox Text(2)
Action.Help: Sets the string that will be used for the object

Action.Name: Get CheckBox Text(2)
Action.Help: Returns the pointer to the text string used

Action.Name: Set EditBox Text
Action.Code: EbSetText((EDITBOX *)GOLFindObject(ID_[CONTROLID_NOINDEX][CONTROLID_INDEX]), (XCHAR *) $Quoted string constant or variable:|"New text"$);[NEWLINE]
Action.Help: Sets the text to be used for the object

Action.Name: Add a character at the end
Action.Help: Inserts a character at the end of the text used by the object

Action.Name: Delete last character
Action.Help: Removes a character at the end of the text used by the object

Action.Name: Edit text using EditNumUpDown
Set RadioButton Text
Action.Code: RbSetText((RADIOBUTTON *)GOLFindObject(ID_[CONTROLID_NOINDEX][CONTROLID_INDEX]), (XCHAR *) $Quoted string constant or variable:|"New text"$);[NEWLINE]
Action.Help: Sets the string used for the object

Action.Name: Get RadioButton Text
Action.Help: Returns pointer to the text string being used

Action.Name: Set RadioButton State to ON (checked)
Action.Help: This function sets the Radio Button to its checked state.

Action.Name: Get ID of the checked button in group
Action.Help: Returns the ID of the selected button in the group. It returns -1 if there is no object checked

Action.Name: Set Window Text
Action.Code: WndSetText((WINDOW *)GOLFindObject(ID_[CONTROLID_NOINDEX][CONTROLID_INDEX]), (XCHAR *) $Quoted string constant or variable:|"New text"$);[NEWLINE]
Action.Help: Sets the string used for the title bar

Action.Name: Get Window Text
Action.Help: Returns the address of the current text string used for the title bar

Action.Name: Set GroupBox Text
Action.Code: GbSetText((GROUPBOX *)GOLFindObject(ID_[CONTROLID_NOINDEX][CONTROLID_INDEX]), (XCHAR *) $Quoted string constant or variable:|"New text"$);[NEWLINE]
Action.Help: Sets the string used for the object

Action.Name: Get GroupBox Text
Action.Help: Returns pointer to the text string being used

Action.Name: Append item
Action.Code: LbAddItem(pLb[CONTROLID_NOINDEX][CONTROLID_INDEX], NULL, (XCHAR *) $Quoted string constant or variable:|"New item"$, NULL, LB_STS_REDRAW, 0);[NEWLINE]
Action.Help: Adds a new item to the Listbox

Action.Name: Get selected item
Action.Help: Get selected item in the Listbox (text and data)

Action.Name: Get selected item's text
Action.Help: Get text of selected item

Action.Name: Get selected item's data
Action.Help: Get data from selected item

Action.Name: Set Picture Bitmap
Action.Code: PictSetBitmap((PICTURE *)GOLFindObject(ID_[CONTROLID_NOINDEX][CONTROLID_INDEX]), (void *)&%BITMAP%); // Replace %BITMAP% with bitmap name as found in the Bitmap chooser[NEWLINE]
Action.Help: Sets the bitmap used in the object

Action.Name: Get Picture Bitmap
Action.Help: Returns the pointer to the bitmap used in the object

Action.Name: Get Picture Scale factor
Action.Help: Returns the current scale factor used to display the bitmap

Action.Name: Set Picture Scale factor
Action.Help: Sets the scale factor used to render the bitmap used in the object

Action.Name: Get ProgressBar Position
Action.Help: Returns the current progress bar position

Action.Name: Get ProgressBar Position and put it in a variable
Action.Help: Sets a variable with the current progress bar position

Action.Name: Set ProgressBar Position
Action.Help: Sets the position of the progress bar. Position should be in the given range inclusive

Action.Name: Redraw Bar
Action.Help: Redraws the Bar only. Use after having changed ProgressBar Position

Action.Name: Get ProgressBar Range
Action.Code: $Variable name where to store range:|myRange$ = PbGetRange((PROGRESSBAR *)GOLFindObject(ID_[CONTROLID_NOINDEX][CONTROLID_INDEX]));[NEWLINE]
Action.Help: Returns the current range of the progress bar

Action.Name: Set ProgressBar Range
Action.Help: Sets the range of the progress bar. Calling this function also resets the position equal to the new range value

Action.Name: Get ProgressBar Position (2)
Action.Help: Returns the current progress bar position

Action.Name: Get ProgressBar Position and put it in a variable (2)
Action.Help: Sets a variable with the current progress bar position

Action.Name: Set ProgressBar Position (2)
Action.Help: Sets the position of the progress bar. Position should be in the given range inclusive

Action.Name: Redraw Bar (2)
Action.Help: Redraws the Bar only. Use after having changed ProgressBar Position

Action.Name: Get ProgressBar Range (2)
Action.Help: Returns the current range of the progress bar

Action.Name: Set ProgressBar Range (2)
Action.Help: Sets the range of the progress bar. Calling this function also resets the position equal to the new range value

Action.Name: Get RoundDial Position
Action.Help: Returns the current dial value. Value is always in the 0-max range inclusive

Action.Name: Get RoundDial Position and store it in a variable
Action.Help: Saves the current dial value in a variable.

Action.Name: Set RoundDial Position
Action.Help: Sets the value to the given new value. Value set must be in 0-max range inclusive

Action.Name: Increment RoundDial Position
Action.Help: Directly increment the value. The delta change used is the resolution setting (res).

Action.Name: Decrement RoundDial Position
Action.Help: Directly decrement the value. The delta change used is the resolution setting (res).

Action.Name: Get Slider Position
Action.Help: Returns the current position of the slider's thumb

Action.Name: Get Slider Position and store it in a variable
Action.Help: Stores the current position of the slider's thumb in a variable

Action.Name: Set Slider Position
Action.Help: Sets the position of the slider thumb. Value should be in the set range inclusive. Object must be redrawn to reflect the change

Action.Name: Get Slider Range
Action.Help: Returns the current range of the thumb

Action.Name: Set Slider Range
Action.Help: Sets the range of the thumb. If this field is changed Object must be completely redrawn to reflect the change

Action.Name: Get Slider Position (2)
Action.Help: Returns the current position of the slider's thumb

Action.Name: Get Slider Position and store it in a variable (2)
Action.Help: Stores the current position of the slider's thumb in a variable

Action.Name: Set Slider Position (2)
Action.Help: Sets the position of the slider thumb. Value should be in the set range inclusive. Object must be redrawn to reflect the change

Action.Name: Get Slider Range (2)
Action.Help: Returns the current range of the thumb

Action.Name: Set Slider Range (2)
Action.Help: Sets the range of the thumb. If this field is changed Object must be completely redrawn to reflect the change

Action.Name: Set Meter Value
Action.Help: Sets the value of the meter

Action.Name: Get Meter Value
Action.Help: Gets the current value of the meter

Action.Name: Increment Meter Value
Action.Help: This macro is used to directly increment the value of the meter

Action.Name: Decrement Meter Value
Action.Help: This macro is used to directly decrement the value of the meter

Action.Name: Clear Text Buffer
Action.Help: This function will clear the data in the display. You must set the drawing state bit TE_UPDATE_TEXT to update the TEXTENTRY on the screen

Action.Name: Use Text Buffer
Action.Help: Returns a pointer to the buffer used

Action.Name: Set TextEntry Text
Action.Code: TeSetBuffer((TEXTENTRY *)GOLFindObject(ID_[CONTROLID_NOINDEX][CONTROLID_INDEX]), (XCHAR *)$Quoted string constant or variable:|"New text"$, (WORD) MaxSize);[NEWLINE]
Action.Help: This function sets the buffer used to display text. If the buffer is initialized with a string, the string must be a null terminated string. If the string length is greater than MaxSize, string will be truncated to MaxSize. pText must point to a valid memory location with size equal to MaxSize+1. The +1 is used for the string terminator

ComboBox.Header: // ComboBox - IDs for Widgets created by [CONTROLID_NOINDEX][CONTROLID_INDEX]

SuperGauge.Code: p[CONTROLID_NOINDEX][CONTROLID_INDEX] = SgCreate(ID_[CONTROLID_NOINDEX][CONTROLID_INDEX],[LEFT],[TOP],[RIGHT],[BOTTOM],[STATE] ,(void *)&[DIALSCALEFONT] // pDialScaleFont ,(XCHAR*)[WIDGETTEXT] ,[SEGMENTSCOUNT] // SegmentsCount ,(void *)&Segments[CONTROLID_NOINDEX][CONTROLID_INDEX] // pSegments ,[PARAMETERS] // SuperGauge Parameters ,GOLScheme_[SCHEME]);

BarGraph.Code: p[CONTROLID_NOINDEX][CONTROLID_INDEX] = BgCreate(ID_[CONTROLID_NOINDEX][CONTROLID_INDEX],[LEFT],[TOP],[RIGHT],[BOTTOM] ,[STATE] // State ,[SEGMENTSCOUNT] // Segments Count ,(void *)&Segments[CONTROLID_NOINDEX][CONTROLID_INDEX] // pSegments ,[PARAMETERS] // BarGraph Parameters ,GOLScheme_[SCHEME]);

MsgBox.Code: p[CONTROLID_NOINDEX][CONTROLID_INDEX] = MsgBoxCreate(ID_[CONTROLID_NOINDEX][CONTROLID_INDEX],[LEFT],[TOP],[RIGHT],[BOTTOM] ,[RADIUS] // Radius ,[BUTTONSTODISPLAY] // Buttons to display ,(XCHAR*)[WIDGETTEXT] // Main message ,(XCHAR*)[CAPTIONTEXT] // Caption message ,[STATE] // State ,[BITMAP] // Bitmap for main message ,[CAPTIONBITMAP] // Bitmap for the caption ,GOLScheme_[SCHEME] // GOL Scheme for MsgBox body ,GOLScheme_[BUTTONS_SCHEME] // GOL Scheme for the buttons ,[RELEASEDKEY_BITMAP] // Bitmap for the released key ,[PRESSEDKEY_BITMAP] // Bitmap for the pressed key );

TextEntryEx.Code: p[CONTROLID] = TeExCreate(ID_[CONTROLID_NOINDEX][CONTROLID_INDEX],[LEFT],[TOP],[RIGHT],[BOTTOM] ,[STATE] // Initial state for the Widget ,[CONTROLID_NOINDEX][CONTROLID_INDEX]_KEYS // Array of key texts ,[CONTROLID_NOINDEX][CONTROLID_INDEX]_KEYSALTERNATE // Array of alternate key texts ,[CONTROLID_NOINDEX][CONTROLID_INDEX]_KEYSSHIFT // Array of shift key texts ,[CONTROLID_NOINDEX][CONTROLID_INDEX]_KEYSSHIFTALTERNATE // Array of shift key texts ,(INT16[])[COMMANDKEYS] // Command key indexes ,(XCHAR*)[CONTROLID]_Text // Buffer of typed text ,[BITMAPPRESSED] // Bitmap for pressed key ,[BITMAPRELEASED] // Bitmap for released key ,(void *)&[DISPFONT] // Font for displaying typed text ,[PARAMETERS] // TextEntryEx Parameters ,GOLScheme_[SCHEME] // Scheme );

Event.Name: TEEX_MSG_CAPSLOCK
Event.Description: Shift key has been pressed for more than about 1 second

Action.Name: Clear Text Buffer
Action.Help: This function will clear the data in the display. You must set the drawing state bit TEEX_UPDATE_TEXT to update the TEXTENTRYEX on the screen

Action.Name: Use Text Buffer
Action.Help: Returns a pointer to the buffer used

Action.Name: Set TextEntryEx Text
Action.Code: TeExSetBuffer((TEXTENTRYEX *)GOLFindObject(ID_[CONTROLID_NOINDEX][CONTROLID_INDEX]), (XCHAR *)$Quoted string constant or variable:|"New text"$, (WORD) MaxSize);[NEWLINE]
Action.Help: This function sets the buffer used to display text. If the buffer is initialized with a string, the string must be a null terminated string. If the string length is greater than MaxSize, string will be truncated to MaxSize. pText must point to a valid memory location with size equal to MaxSize+1. The +1 is used for the string terminator

Action.Name: Set StaticTextEx Text
Action.Code: StExSetText((STATICTEXTEX *)GOLFindObject(ID_[CONTROLID_NOINDEX][CONTROLID_INDEX]), (XCHAR *) $Quoted string constant or variable:|"New text"$);[NEWLINE]
Action.Help: Sets the string that will be used for the object

Action.Name: Get StaticTextEx Text
Action.Help: Returns the pointer to the text string used

StringsPoolTemplate.StringsPoolHeader: // StringsPool.h - DO NOT EDIT THIS FILE [STRINGSPOOLDEFINES]

ClosingBlock.Header: #define VGDD_NUM_SCREENS [VGDD_NUM_SCREENS] // Number of Screens in this VGDD project #define VGDD_LAST_ID [VGDD_LAST_ID] // Last Widget ID used by VGDD - You can start from VGDD_LAST_ID+1 for extra-VGDD Widgets #define SCREENSTATE_INIT [FIRST_SCREEN_IN_PROJECT] #endif // ifndef _VGDD_SCREENS_H_
